title.value: Molecular differentiation of the isolates of Venturia inaequalis

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Kulik, E.V., Belarus State Univ., Minsk (Belarus)
Komardina, V.S., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection
Sarosek, A.I., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)
Evtushenkov, A.N., Belarus State Univ., Minsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: One of the most widespread diseases of apple (Malus domestica) appears apple scab, caused by heterothallic ascomycete Venturia inaequalis. For the development of effective disease protective systems the information about genetic variability of the fungus is necessary. Determination of molecular differentiation of Venturia inaequalis appears and important stage of the identification of different genetic groups and allows forecasting the spread of new pathotypes, affecting disease resistant apple sorts. Ribosomal DNA (rDNA) analysis revealed genetic variations in Belarusian population of Venturia inaequalis. It is found that the majority of isolates lacking the intron. These findings suppose that the Belarusian population of Venturia inaequalis differs considerably from the European population. The described intron alleles in Venturia inaequalis could be used as genetic markers for subdividing populations of the fungus. Different races (3 and with high probability – 2, 4 and 5) have been identified within the Belarusian population of the Venturia inaequalis based on restriction analysis of the 18S rDNA.
